plugin.name: ‚è± Habits and Summaries
plugin.description: Generate summaries from notes for a given time period and saves to notes; show heatmap of when tasks were completed. Click link for more details and settings.
plugin.author: Jonathan Clark

plugin.settings.title: Folders to exclude
plugin.settings.description: List of folders to exclude in these commands. May be empty. (Note that @Trash, @Templates and @Archive are always excluded.)

plugin.settings.title: Heading level
plugin.settings.description: Heading level (1-5) to use when writing headings to notes

plugin.settings.title: Yes/No characters
plugin.settings.description:
Pair of characters to use as Yes and No in output of Yes/No progress items. The first is for Yes, the second for No.
Here are some you might like to use for Yes: ‚úì‚úî‚ñ†‚ß´‚ñâ and for No: ¬∑‚ó¶‚úï‚úñ‚óå‚ñ°.
You can use emojis, such as ‚úÖüü¢‚ùåüëéüî¥, but they are likely to mess up the horizontal spacing.

plugin.settings.title: Exclude today's entries?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to exclude today's entries in summaries. Can be enabled if you tend to run the commands as part of a start-of-day routine, and only add the updates later in the day.

plugin.settings.title: What time period should the Progress update cover?
plugin.settings.description:
Pick one of the options: 'wtd' (week to date), 'userwtd' (user's week to date), 'last7d' (last 7 days), 'mtd' (month to date), 'last2w' (last 2 weeks), 'last4w' (last 4 weeks).
(This can be overriden when called from a Template by setting the relevant parameter.)

plugin.settings.title: Where to write the progress update?
plugin.settings.description:
Append to 'current' note, or to the current 'daily' or 'weekly' note.
(If the progress update section already exists, it will be updated, rather than be repeated.)

plugin.settings.title: Progress heading
plugin.settings.description: Heading to go before this output, to which is added the period that's covered. However, if it contains the string {{PERIOD}}, then the covered period will be inserted in place of this string wherever you want in the heading. If this is left blank, then no heading will be added.

plugin.settings.title: Include sparkline graphs?
plugin.settings.description:
Where appropriate, this adds basic ASCII-art sparklines for each item, reflecting each day's data in the period.
Note: Sparklines won't be shown where the summarised time period is more than a month.

plugin.settings.title: Yes/No items
plugin.settings.description:
Comma-separated list of #hashtags and/or @mentions to track by 'did I do it this day or not?'.
(Note: you need to include the @ or # on the front.)

plugin.settings.title: #hashtags to count
plugin.settings.description:
List of simple #hashtags to include in Progress updates. If this list is empty, no hashtags will be included.
(Note: you need to include the # of the #hashtag.)

plugin.settings.title: #hashtags to average
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of #hashtag/<number> to include in Progress updates, presented as an average.
(Note: you need to include the # of the #hashtag.)

plugin.settings.title: #hashtags to total
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of #hashtag/<number> to include in Progress updates, presented as a total.
(Note: you need to include the # of the #hashtag.)

plugin.settings.title: @mentions to count
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of simple @mentions to include in Progress updates. If this list is empty, no mentions will be included.
(Note: you need to include the @ of the @mention.)

plugin.settings.title: @mentions to average
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of @mention(number) to include in Progress updates, presented as an average.
(Note: you need to include the @ of the @mention.)

plugin.settings.title: @mentions to total
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of @mention(number)s to include in Progress updates, presented as a total.
(Note: you need to include the @ of the @mention.)

plugin.settings.title: Title of Reference note for checklist items
plugin.settings.description: Title of the note to use as a reference for checklist items. If this is left blank, then no reference note will be used.

plugin.settings.title: Default days to display
plugin.settings.description: Default number of days to show in the Charts

plugin.settings.title: Tags to show as totals
plugin.settings.description: Tags that should show totals instead of averages in the summary.

plugin.settings.title: Tags to display using time format
plugin.settings.description: Tags to display as HH:MM in charts (e.g. '@bedtime' or '@sleep'. Note: this does not itself ask for a tag to be included in the summary list.

plugin.settings.title: Chart height (px)
plugin.settings.description: Height in pixels for numeric-tag charts.

plugin.settings.title: Colors for Charts
plugin.settings.description:
Comma-separated list of colors to use in the charts. Supported color formats are:
- CSS names (e.g. 'red', 'blue')
- Tailwind color names (e.g. 'sky-500', 'blue-500')
- RGB Hex (e.g. '#F00', '#FF0000')
- RGB decimal (e.g. 'rgba(255 0 0 / 0.7)')
- HSL (e.g. 'hsl(0 100% 50%)')
(If this is left blank, the default colors will be used.)
plugin.settings.default: blue-500, purple, yellow-500, green-500, red, orange, cyan-500, pink-500, brown, sky-500, #ff2d55, emerald-500, grey

plugin.settings.title: Non-zero Y-axis tags (JSON)
plugin.settings.description: JSON object mapping tag names to { min, max } for chart Y-axis (e.g. {"@bedtime":{"min":20,"max":24},"@sleep":{"min":5,"max":10}}). Leave empty {} to use defaults.

plugin.settings.title: Significant figures for stats
plugin.settings.description: Number of significant figures for summary statistics in charts.

plugin.settings.title: Chart average line
plugin.settings.description: Type of average line to show on numeric charts: 'none' (no average), 'moving' (7-day moving average), 'weekly' (average of each successive 7-day period).

plugin.settings.title: Folder to store summary notes in
plugin.settings.description:
Name of the Folder to store the summaries in.
Note: the first option will be to use the built-in daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly or yearly notes instead. That will also be used if this is empty.

plugin.settings.title: Stats heading
plugin.settings.description: Heading to go before the output section. The plugin adds to it the period that the stats covers.

plugin.settings.title: Heading before hashtags stats
plugin.settings.description: (Optional) Heading to go before section of #hashtag stats

plugin.settings.title: Heading before mentions stats
plugin.settings.description: (Optional) Heading to go before section of @mention stats

plugin.settings.title: Include sparkline graphs?
plugin.settings.description:
Show basic ASCII-art sparklines for each item, reflecting each day's data in the period.
Note: Sparklines won't be shown where the summarised time period is more than a month.

plugin.settings.title: Show hashtag or mention as links?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show the # or @ symbols, or hide them to stop them being active links. (Beware double counting if you turn this on and save results in daily notes.)

plugin.settings.title: Yes/No items
plugin.settings.description:
Comma-separated list of #hashtags and/or @mentions to track by 'did I do it this day or not?'.
Note: you need to include the @ or # on the front.

plugin.settings.title: #hashtags to count
plugin.settings.description: List of #hashtags to include in counts (e.g. '#holiday', '#jog', '#commute', '#webinar').
plugin.settings._description: List of #hashtags to include in counts (e.g. '#holiday', '#jog', '#commute', '#webinar'). These take precedence over any excluded hashtags (below). If this list is empty, all hashtags will be included.

plugin.settings.title: #hashtags to average
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of #hashtag(number)s to include in Period Stats updates, presented as an average.
(Note: you need to include the # of the #hashtag.)

plugin.settings.title: #hashtags to total
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of #hashtag(number)s to include in Period Stats updates, presented as a total.
(Note: you need to include the # of the #hashtag.)

plugin.settings.title: @mentions to count
plugin.settings.description: List of @mentions to include in counts (e.g. '@gym', '@sleepOnTime').
plugin.settings._description: List of @mentions to include in counts (e.g. '@gym', '@sleepOnTime'). These take precedence over any excluded mentions (below). If this list is empty, all mentions will be included.

plugin.settings.title: @mentions to average
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of @mention(number)s to include in Period Stats updates, presented as an average.
(Note: you need to include the @ of the @mention.)

plugin.settings.title: @mentions to total
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of @mention(number)s to include in Period Stats updates, presented as a total.
(Note: you need to include the @ of the @mention.)

plugin.settings.title: #hashtags and @mentions to total
plugin.settings.description: List of #hashtags and @mentions to include in Today Progress updates.

plugin.settings.title: Today Progress heading
plugin.settings.description: Heading to go before this output. If this is left blank, then no heading will be added (and no refresh button).

plugin.settings.title: Chart Duration (in weeks)
plugin.settings.description: Number of weeks to look back when generating stats (including heatmaps), not including sparklines.

plugin.settings.title: Include current week?
plugin.settings.description: Whether this include the (probably incomplete) current week, or only completed weeks.

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description: Set how much output will be displayed for this plugin in the NotePlan > Help > Plugin Console. DEBUG is the most verbose; NONE is the least (silent).

plugin.settings-disabled.title: Yes/No habits for charts
plugin.settings-disabled.description: List of #hashtags and/or @mentions to track as yes/no in the chart (e.g. '#pray', '#stretches'). Include the # or @.

plugin.settings-disabled.title: Yes/No chart height (px)
plugin.settings-disabled.description: Height in pixels for yes/no habit charts.

plugin.settings-disabled.title: Items to Chart
plugin.settings-disabled.description: List of @mentions or #hashtags to generate stats ready to chart.
